segment.target: How to Manage MBAM Client BitLocker Encryption Options by Using the Control Panel

segment.source: A Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) control panel application, called BitLocker Encryption Options, will be available under System and Security when the MBAM Client is installed.
segment.target: A Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) control panel application, called BitLocker Encryption Options, will be available under System and Security when the MBAM Client is installed.

segment.source: This customized MBAM control panel replaces the default Windows BitLocker control panel.
segment.target: This customized MBAM control panel replaces the default Windows BitLocker control panel.

segment.source: The MBAM control panel enables you to unlock encrypted drives (fixed and removable), and also helps you manage your PIN or password.
segment.target: The MBAM control panel enables you to unlock encrypted drives (fixed and removable), and also helps you manage your PIN or password.

segment.source: For more information about enabling the MBAM control panel, see How to Hide Default BitLocker Encryption in The Windows Control Panel.
segment.target: For more information about enabling the MBAM control panel, see How to Hide Default BitLocker Encryption in The Windows Control Panel.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For the BitLocker client, the Admin and Operational log files are located in Event Viewer, under Application and Services LogsMicrosoftWindowsBitLockerManagement.
segment.target: For the BitLocker client, the Admin and Operational log files are located in Event Viewer, under Application and Services LogsMicrosoftWindowsBitLockerManagement.

segment.source: To use the MBAM Client Control Panel
segment.target: To use the MBAM Client Control Panel

segment.source: To open BitLocker Encryption Options, click Start, and then select Control Panel.
segment.target: To open BitLocker Encryption Options, click Start, and then select Control Panel.

segment.source: When Control Panel opens, select System and Security.
segment.target: When Control Panel opens, select System and Security.

segment.source: Double-click BitLocker Encryption Options to open the customized MBAM control panel.
segment.target: Double-click BitLocker Encryption Options to open the customized MBAM control panel.

segment.source: You will see a list of all the hard disk drives on the computer and their encryption status.
segment.target: You will see a list of all the hard disk drives on the computer and their encryption status.

segment.source: You will also see an option to manage your PIN or passwords.
segment.target: You will also see an option to manage your PIN or passwords.

segment.source: Use the list of hard disk drives on the computer to verify the encryption status, unlock a drive, or request an exemption for BitLocker protection if the User and Computer Exemption policies have been deployed.
segment.target: Use the list of hard disk drives on the computer to verify the encryption status, unlock a drive, or request an exemption for BitLocker protection if the User and Computer Exemption policies have been deployed.

segment.source: Non-administrators can use the BitLocker Encryption Options control panel to manage PINs or passwords.
segment.target: Non-administrators can use the BitLocker Encryption Options control panel to manage PINs or passwords.

segment.source: A user can select Manage PIN, and then enter both a current PIN and a new PIN.
segment.target: A user can select Manage PIN, and then enter both a current PIN and a new PIN.

segment.source: Users can also confirm their new PIN.
segment.target: Users can also confirm their new PIN.

segment.source: The Update PIN function will reset the PIN to the new one that the user selects.
segment.target: The Update PIN function will reset the PIN to the new one that the user selects.

segment.source: To manage your password, select Unlock drive and enter your current password.
segment.target: To manage your password, select Unlock drive and enter your current password.

segment.source: As soon as the drive is unlocked, select Reset Password to change your current password.
segment.target: As soon as the drive is unlocked, select Reset Password to change your current password.
